page.title: 15ST.AUGUSTINE'S HOME
page.content: {St.Augustine's Home}is well known in Jersey. It opened in 1886, founded by {Jeanne Jegou}who had already opened a small house in Brittany in 1839 as the first hostel of{The Little Sisters of {the Poor.} In Jersey the home is very modern and lovely to see standing on high ground overlooking the town of St.Helier and Elizabeth Castle. There are about 90 patients all over 60. The home is run by 14 Sisters and domestic help together with local doctors. Each person is taken into the home on merit or need. The funds come from the inmates, from legacies and benefactors and some from the general public. The Sisters are{Catholic,}but people of any religion are taken into the home. Only the chapel and the nunnery are original buildings, and all the rest has been recently rebuilt.
